dublinCore.dc:title: 113 HR 3609 IH: To designate the facility of the United States Postal Service located at 3260 Broad Street in Port Henry, New York, as the Dain Taylor Venne Post Office Building.
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Owens (for himself, Mr. Bishop of New York, Mr. King of New York, Mr. Israel, Mrs. McCarthy of New York, Mr. Meeks, Ms. Meng, Ms. Vel√°zquez, Ms. Clarke, Mr. Nadler, Mr. Grimm, Mr. Rangel, Mr. Crowley, Mr. Serrano, Mr. Engel, Mr. Sean Patrick Maloney of New York, Mr. Gibson, Mr. Tonko, Mr. Hanna, Mr. Reed, Mr. Maffei, Ms. Slaughter, Mr. Higgins, Mr. Collins of New York, and Mrs. Carolyn B. Maloney of New York) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Oversight and Government Reform

form.official-title: To designate the facility of the United States Postal Service located at 3260 Broad Street in Port Henry, New York, as the Dain Taylor Venne Post Office Building.

section.header: Dain Taylor Venne Post Office Building

subsection.text: The facility of the United States Postal Service located at 3260 Broad Street in Port Henry, New York, shall be known and designated as the Dain Taylor Venne Post Office Building.

Any reference in a law, map, regulation, document, paper, or other record of the United States to the facility referred to in subsection (a) shall be deemed to be a reference to the Dain Taylor Venne Post Office Building.
